verses.roman:
aty-āsārāti-vātena
paśavo jāta-vepanāḥ
gopā gopyaś ca śītārtā
govindaṁ śaraṇaṁ yayuḥ

synonyms: ati-āsāra—by the excessive rainfall; ati-vātena—and the excessive wind; paśavaḥ—the cows and other animals; jāta-vepanāḥ—trembling; gopāḥ—the cowherd men; gopyaḥ—the cowherd ladies; ca—also; śīta—by the cold; ārtāḥ—distressed; govindam—to Lord Govinda; śaraṇam—for shelter; yayuḥ—they went.
translation: The cows and other animals, shivering from the excessive rain and wind, and the cowherd men and ladies, pained by the cold, all approached Lord Govinda for shelter.
